        public OrderService()

    • Method Detail

      • getAll

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getAll​(User loggedInUser)
        Only ADMINS have the right to get all the Orders. ADMIN: Can get ALL the Orders. MANAGER, DIRECTOR, ELSE: FORBIDDEN
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns A ResponseEntity with All the Orders based on the Role of the User who logged in.

      • getById

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getById​(User loggedInUser,
                                                       Long id)
        Returns the Order by ID. ADMIN: Can get All the Orders. DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Get orders if issued by, or for the company the user works at. ELSE - FORBIDDEN Non existing ID - NOT FOUND
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        id - The ID of the Order to return.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity of the Order.

      • getHistoriesByOrderId

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getHistoriesByOrderId​(User loggedInUser,
                                                                     Long id)
        Returns the Histories of the order with the requested ID, filtered by Role, Only those users can access the history who works in the same company as the Creator of the history, and who works at one of the companies of the Order to which the History belongs to. (Plus ADMINS) ADMIN: Can get ALL DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Can get Data if works in the same company as the Creator of the history, and also works at one of the companies of the Order to which the History belongs to. ELSE: FORBIDDEN Non existing Order: NOTFOUND
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        id - The ID of the Order to get the Histories of.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity of the Histories.

      • postHistoryForOrderById

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity postHistoryForOrderById​(HistoryDTO historyDTO,
                                                                       User loggedInUser,
                                                                       Long idOfOrder)
        Creates a new record of History for the Selected Order. ADMIN: Can add new Histories without any regulations. DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Only can add History if the user works in the same company as the Creator of the history, and also works at one of the companies of the Order to which the History belongs to. ELSE: FORBIDDEN
        Parameters:
        idOfOrder - The ID of Order to which we want to add the history to.
        historyDTO - The history Data Transfer Object with the information to save.
        loggedInUser - The user logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity of the saved History.

      • getSalesByUser

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getSalesByUser​(User loggedInUser)
        Returns the Sales of the Company the user works at. ADMIN, DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Get orders if issued by, or for the company the user works at (even admins) ELSE - FORBIDDEN ID NOT FOUND - NOT FOUND Unemployed user - BAD REQUEST
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity with the Orders where the user's company is a seller.

      • getPurchasesByUser

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getPurchasesByUser​(User loggedInUser)
        Returns the Purchases of the Company the user works at. ADMIN, DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Get orders if issued by, or for the company the user works at (even admins) ELSE - FORBIDDEN ID NOT FOUND - NOT FOUND Unemployed user - BAD REQUEST
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity with the Orders where the user's company is a buyer.

      • getOrdersOfUser

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getOrdersOfUser​(User loggedInUser)
        Returns the Orders assigned to the user. ADMIN, DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Get orders if handled by the user. ELSE - FORBIDDEN ID NOT FOUND - NOT FOUND Unemployed user - BAD REQUEST
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity with the Orders where the user's company is a buyer.

      • putById

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity putById​(OrderDTO orderDTO,
                                                       User loggedInUser,
                                                       Long id)
        Updates the Order by ID. ADMIN: Can save any of the Order. DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Update Order if issued by, or for the company the user works at. ELSE: FORBIDDEN Non existing Order: NOTFOUND
        Parameters:
        orderDTO - The Order Data Transfer Object with the information to update.
        loggedInUser - The user logged in.
        id - The ID of the Order the user wants to PUT (Update).
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity of the updated Order.

      • addOrder

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity addOrder​(OrderDTO orderDTO,
                                                        User loggedInUser)
        Creates a new record of Order. ADMIN: Can add new Order without any regulations. DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Can only add Order of the Company the user works at is a seller or a buyer in the Order. ELSE: FORBIDDEN Already existing Order: BAD REQUEST
        Parameters:
        orderDTO - The Order Data Transfer Object with the information to save.
        loggedInUser - The user logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity of the saved Order.

      • deleteById

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteById​(Long id,
                                                          User loggedInUser)
        Deletes an Order record by ID. ADMIN: Can delete any Order without any regulations. DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Can only delete Order of the Company the user works at is a seller or a buyer in the Order. ELSE: FORBIDDEN Non existing Order: NOTFOUND
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Company the user wants to DELETE.
        loggedInUser - The user logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity: OK if the deletion was successful and NotFound if the record was not found.

      • getMap

        public Map<Long,​Order> getMap​(User loggedInUser)
        Returns a Map with the orders of a company the User works at. Unauthorized if the key value is null.
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a Map[Integer, Order] with the ID-s of the Orders are the keys.
